name: bbn\Db\Internal\Structure

getForeignKeys.name: getForeignKeys
getForeignKeys.summary: Return an array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key.

arguments.name: db
arguments.description: The database name if different from the current one

params.name: $db
params.description: The database name if different from the current one

doc.return: with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key

getForeignKeys.comments:
/**
   * Return an array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getForeignKeys('id', 'table_users', 'db_example'));
   * // (Array)
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $col The column's name
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @param string|null $db The database name if different from the current one
   * @return array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key
   */

hasIdIncrement.name: hasIdIncrement
hasIdIncrement.summary: Return true if in the table there are fields with auto-increment.
hasIdIncrement.comments:
/**
   * Return true if in the table there are fields with auto-increment.
   * Working only on mysql.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->hasIdIncrement('table_users'));
   * // (bool) 1
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return bool
   */

modelize.name: modelize
modelize.summary: Return the table's structure as an indexed array.

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: If set to true will force the modernization to re-perform even if the cache exists

doc.description:
Return the table's structure as an indexed array.

X::hdump($ctrl->db->modelize('my_date_2')); /*
"fields": {
    "ID": {
        "position": 1,
        "type": "int",
        "null": 0,
        "key": null,
        "extra": "",
        "signed": true,
        "virtual": false,
        "generation": "",
        "maxlength": 10,
    },

params.name: $force
params.description: If set to true will force the modernization to re-perform even if the cache exists

modelize.comments:
/**
   * Return the table's structure as an indexed array.
   * 
   * X::hdump($ctrl->db->modelize('my_date_2')); /*    
   * "fields": {
   *     "ID": {
   *         "position": 1,
   *         "type": "int",
   *         "null": 0,
   *         "key": null,
   *         "extra": "",
   *         "signed": true,
   *         "virtual": false,
   *         "generation": "",
   *         "maxlength": 10,
   *     },
   * 
   *
   * @param null|array|string $table The table's name
   * @param bool              $force If set to true will force the modernization to re-perform even if the cache exists
   * @return null|array
   */

convert.name: convert
convert.summary: Converts the given configuration (modelize) to the given engine.

doc.description: Converts the given configuration (modelize) to the given engine.

convert.comments:
/**
   * Converts the given configuration (modelize) to the given engine.
   * @param array $cfg The configuration to convert
   * @param string $engine The engine to convert to
   * @return array
   */

getColMaxLength.name: getColMaxLength

fmodelize.name: fmodelize
fmodelize.summary: Return the table's structure as an indexed array.

doc.description:
Return the table's structure as an indexed array.

```php
X::hdump($ctrl->db->fmodelize('my_date_2'));
```

fmodelize.comments:
/** 
   * Return the table's structure as an indexed array.
   * 
   * ```php
   * X::hdump($ctrl->db->fmodelize('my_date_2'));
   * ```
   * 
   * @param string $table
   * @param bool   $force
   * @return null|array
   */

findReferences.name: findReferences

getPrimary.name: getPrimary
getPrimary.summary: Return primary keys of a table as a numeric array.
getPrimary.comments:
/**
   * Return primary keys of a table as a numeric array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db-> get_primary('table_users'));
   * // (array) ["id"]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */

getSinglePrimary.name: getSinglePrimary
getSinglePrimary.summary: Return primary keys of a table as a string if there is a single-column unique key.
getSinglePrimary.comments:
/**
   * Return primary keys of a table as a string if there is a single-column unique key.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db-> getSinglePrimary('table_users'));
   * // (string) "id"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */

getUniquePrimary.name: getUniquePrimary
getUniquePrimary.summary: Return the unique primary key of the given table.
getUniquePrimary.comments:
/**
   * Return the unique primary key of the given table.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getUniquePrimary('table_users'));
   * // (string) id
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return null|string
   */

getUniqueKeys.name: getUniqueKeys
getUniqueKeys.summary: Return the unique keys of a table as a numeric array.
getUniqueKeys.comments:
/**
   * Return the unique keys of a table as a numeric array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getUniqueKeys('table_users'));
   * // (array) ["userid", "userdataid"]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */

setDatabaseCharset.name: setDatabaseCharset
setDatabaseCharset.summary: Changes the charset to the given database

doc.description: Changes the charset to the given database

setDatabaseCharset.comments:
/**
   * Changes the charset to the given database
   * @param string $database The database's name
   * @param string $charset The charset to set
   * @param string $collation The collation to set
   */

setTableCharset.name: setTableCharset
setTableCharset.summary: Changes the charset to the given table

doc.description: Changes the charset to the given table

setTableCharset.comments:
/**
   * Changes the charset to the given table
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @param string $charset The charset to set
   * @param string $collation The collation to set
   */

setColumnCharset.name: setColumnCharset
setColumnCharset.summary: Changes the charset to the given column

doc.description: Changes the charset to the given column

setColumnCharset.comments:
/**
   * Changes the charset to the given column
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @param string $column The column's name
   * @param string $charset The charset to set
   * @param string $collation The collation to set
   */

/**
   * Return an array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getForeignKeys('id', 'table_users', 'db_example'));
   * // (Array)
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $col The column's name
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @param string|null $db The database name if different from the current one
   * @return array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key
   */

/**
   * Return true if in the table there are fields with auto-increment.
   * Working only on mysql.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->hasIdIncrement('table_users'));
   * // (bool) 1
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return bool
   */

/**
   * Return the table's structure as an indexed array.
   * 
   * X::hdump($ctrl->db->modelize('my_date_2')); /*    
   * "fields": {
   *     "ID": {
   *         "position": 1,
   *         "type": "int",
   *         "null": 0,
   *         "key": null,
   *         "extra": "",
   *         "signed": true,
   *         "virtual": false,
   *         "generation": "",
   *         "maxlength": 10,
   *     },
   * 
   *
   * @param null|array|string $table The table's name
   * @param bool              $force If set to true will force the modernization to re-perform even if the cache exists
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Converts the given configuration (modelize) to the given engine.
   * @param array $cfg The configuration to convert
   * @param string $engine The engine to convert to
   * @return array
   */

/** 
   * Return the table's structure as an indexed array.
   * 
   * ```php
   * X::hdump($ctrl->db->fmodelize('my_date_2'));
   * ```
   * 
   * @param string $table
   * @param bool   $force
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Return primary keys of a table as a numeric array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db-> get_primary('table_users'));
   * // (array) ["id"]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */

/**
   * Return primary keys of a table as a string if there is a single-column unique key.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db-> getSinglePrimary('table_users'));
   * // (string) "id"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */

/**
   * Return the unique primary key of the given table.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getUniquePrimary('table_users'));
   * // (string) id
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return null|string
   */

   * Return the unique keys of a table as a numeric array.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->getUniqueKeys('table_users'));
   * // (array) ["userid", "userdataid"]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table The table's name
   * @return array
   */
